"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556a95936368726c0c2e0900#post_556a95936368726c0c2e0900

Alright alright, bad might be too strong a word, but to did fell like a step backwards.

It had some ideas (It's pretty much the same principle for the XYZ Monsters in Yu-Gi-Oh!)  but the execution was very underwhelming. I would *+personally+* call it very mediocre.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556a965f6368720b23c30700#post_556a965f6368720b23c30700
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556a95d86368726c0caf0900#post_556a95d86368726c0caf0900
Although considering it's been split up into SIX parts, I'm willing to bet that it started out with a weekly anime format but Toei decided to change it to movies for that exact reason.[/bq]
To be fair can you really blame them?  The digimon franchise really doesn't have a lot of steam left in it; would you really want to see it killed off like how capcom killed off the entire megaman franchise?

The difference between the two is that Toei has realized they fucked up and rather than putting a pillow over it's face while it's sleeping they're actually trying to nurse it back.

topics.body:
So me and my friend visited this cute little seaside town today, determined to hit up as many vintage, crafty shops we could to feel like flower children or some shit. We find a vintage book shop, look through the door to see if it's open...and find a coffin. Dead guy included.

Welp.
